page.title: 03THE HAMLETS
page.content: {GOVETON}and{LEDSTONE} are two small hamlets that sit snugly in sheltered hollows. The population changes slightly with the season but averages about 70. Most of the cottages that were once the homes of farm workers,blacksmiths, saddlers and suchlike,are now owned by holidaymakers,retired folk or people who work elsewhere. Services are still held in the small church of St.Peter which stands high above Goveton and there is a small Post Office/Shop in what was was once the Smithy. Little of the village rural trades survive.The schoolhouse is now a pretty cottage and only the windows betray its past as a chapel. There are some visiting services such as Library,Baker,Hairdresser and course the Milkman.
